Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
The Portfolio class represents a user's investment portfolio. It manages 2 seperate ArrayLists of stocks and mutual funds, allowing for the manipulation of these investments (e.g. buy/sell/update)

      the investment portfolio

    • getOneInvestment

      public ePortfolio.Investment getOneInvestment(String symbol)
      Fetches one one investment from the investment portfolio
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol of the investment we want to fetch
      Returns:
      the investment object if it is found in the portfolio

    • buyInvestment

      public String buyInvestment(String type, String symbol, String name, int buyQuantity, double buyPrice) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Prompts the user to buy an investment (either stock or mutual fund). It checks if the investment already exists in the portfolio. If it does, the method adds to the existing investment. If it doesn't, a new investment is created and added to the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of investment (stock or mutual fund)
      symbol - the symbol of the investment
      name - the name of the investment
      buyQuantity - the quantity of the investment to buy
      buyPrice - the price of the investment
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success of the purchase
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the quantity or price is negative, or if the symbol is empty

    • sellInvestment

      public String sellInvestment(String symbol, int sellQuantity, double sellPrice) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Prompts the user to sell an investment given an investment symbol. It checks if the investment already exists in the portfolio. If it does, the method removes from the existing investment updating its properties accordingly if the sell quantity is less than current quantity. If it is equal the stock is removed from the portfolio.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol of the investment to sell
      sellQuantity - the quantity of the investment to sell
      sellPrice - the price at which the investment is sold
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success of the sale
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the quantity or price is negative, or if the symbol is empty

    • updateInvestmentPrices

      public ePortfolio.Investment updateInvestmentPrices(String symbol, double newPrice)
      Updates the prices of all stocks and mutual funds in the portfolio. This method prompts the user to enter a new price for each investment (both stocks and mutual funds). It ensures that the new price is non-negative before updating the investment's price.
      Parameters:
      symbol - symbol of the investment we want to update
      newPrice - the new price we want to update the investment to
      Returns:
      the investment object if it is found in the portfolio

    • getGainPortfolio

      public void getGainPortfolio()
      Calculates and displays the total gains for the stock and mutual fund portfolios. This method iterates through both the stock and mutual fund portfolios, printing the gain for each individual investment and summing the total gains for each portfolio. Finally, it displays the total gains for both the stock and mutual fund portfolios, as well as the combined total gain for the entire investment portfolio.

    • searchInvestmentPortfolio

      public ArrayList<ePortfolio.Investment> searchInvestmentPortfolio(String symbol, double lowerBound, double upperBound, String keyWordsString)
      Searches the investment portfolio for stocks and mutual funds that match the user's input. The user is prompted to enter a symbol, price range, and set of keywords for the search. The method checks each investment (both stocks and mutual funds) to see if it matches the provided criteria. If a match is found, the investment's details are printed. If no matches are found, a message is displayed indicating that no results were found.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol of the investment to search for
      lowerBound - the lower bound of the price range
      upperBound - the upper bound of the price range
      keyWordsString - the set of keywords to search for
      Returns:
      an array list of investments that match the search criteria

    • saveInvestmentsToFile

      public void saveInvestmentsToFile(String fileName)
      Save existing investment data to specified file declared in command line Saves investment data with specified format in document
      Parameters:
      fileName - string variable containing the filename we want to save our data too
